p: 6-Hydroxycrinamine was also reported to be cytotoxic against human pancreatic (PANC1, IC 50 = 7.20 μg/ml) and prostate (DU145, IC 50 = 2.95 μg/ml) cancer cells [ 32]. Structurally similar compounds to 6-hydroxycrinamine such as haemanthamine and haemanthidine were also found to exert antiproliferative activity against similar cell line A2780 with a lower IC 50 value of 215.78 μg/ml and 452.01 μg/ml, respectively [ 13], while crinamine which lacks 6-hydroxy substitute showed anticancer activity against HPV-positive cervical carcinoma SiHa (IC 50 = 7.09 μg/ml) and HPV-negative cervical carcinoma C33a (IC50 = 18.35 μg/ml) cells as well as induced apoptosis without causing DNA damage [ 33].
